algorithm_technique: Binary search on rows and columns
problem_summary_simple: Find the area of the smallest rectangle enclosing all black pixels in a binary matrix.
problem_summary_technical: Uses binary search to find the boundaries (top, bottom, left, right) of the black pixel region efficiently.
key_insights: The problem requires finding the minimum bounding box of connected '1's.
Since the black pixels form a single component, binary search can efficiently find the extreme rows and columns containing '1's.
The key is to design the binary search predicate to check if a given row/column contains any black pixels.
